body.p:
Grayson Carter County Ky
Govenor Magoffin

William Simmons was fined in our circuit court $20 for Gambling with 3 others the bett was 5 cts Each for a treat of good appel Jack the commonwealths attorney Judge Rice L. W. Andrews written to you at our Spring court that they would Like you would Remitt the fine Lansdown Osington and others of this place being fined for gambling and have him Releast Mr Simmons came to see me yesterday and Requested me to Enquire in to this matter and try to gitt him Releast he is Enclined to think you never Received the former Letter our Post mater is a Blue Belleyd northern man we dont gett but few papers hear that a Reflecting man not under Excitement would Read thay -- dezinen disigning members have miss Lead the common class by saying union demacratick party the thay
are changing fast in favor of the South Judge J. W. Moore will canvass this county next weak for Col Williams woddzworths opposition for Crongress I think Williams will gett a majority in this county Col J. R. Butts made up a company hear yesterday as a State gard all Suthern men I could tell you mutch of the coruptness of a part of the old whigg party hear the I am sattisfied you see it moore playing then I the honest whiggs say that none but our partty can keep this government to gether on the account of our postmasters dishonesy I Enclosed this to the Govern to hand you I would Lick to hear from you before the 20th of this month yours &c

Carter Cir. Ct
$20. } Gaming
Wm Simmons
